user.title: ARP-Scan Device Tracker
user.description: Configure network scanning for device tracking. The integration will scan your network using ARP requests to detect connected devices.

data_description.interface: Select a network interface from the list
data_description.network: Network range in CIDR notation (e.g., 192.168.1.0/24). Leave empty to auto-detect.
data_description.scan_interval: How often to scan for devices (5-300 seconds)
data_description.consider_home: How long to wait before marking a device as not home (10-1800 seconds)
data_description.timeout: Timeout for each ARP request (0.5-10 seconds)
data_description.resolve_hostnames: Look up device hostnames via reverse DNS lookup
data_description.devices_enabled: Enable newly found device tracker entities by default. When disabled, new entities are added but disabled in the entity registry.
data_description.track_new_devices: Automatically create device tracker entities for newly discovered devices. When disabled, only previously known devices are tracked.
data_description.include: Only track devices with these IP addresses (comma-separated list)
data_description.exclude: Skip tracking devices with these IP addresses (comma-separated list)
data_description.hosts: Probe only these IPs instead of scanning the network (for ZeroTier, WireGuard, Tailscale, etc.)

error.cannot_detect_network: Could not detect network for the selected interface. Please specify the network range manually.

abort.cannot_detect_network: Could not detect network configuration. Please check your network settings.
